Not liking this nerf
"Dragon’s Descent does less damage and travels less distance. Overall, we don’t expect these changes will shake up how Dragon’s Descent is used, but we’re pretty sure it’s cooler now."
The damage is irrelevant, but the distance didn't need nerfing.  That was a dumb move.
Yeah...and how is it "cooler"? ...less dragon fire?
You don't transform into a dragon, only to be stopped midair by a cupcake, anymore.
But you lose that "ooh, piece of candy!" look on your dragon when it stops mid descent for the cupcake!

Probably because a Juggernaut shouldn't have a long range gap closer/engage tool. I mean she's already ignoring a core Juggernaut weakness by having it in the 1st place. Nerfing the distance of the jump enforce the idea "You still got to get up close to do shit" that applies to Juggernauts. She's not Hecarim or Jarvan after all. That's probably the reason for the change.

but she lacks the CC or utility or burst damage to do as much as most other juggernauts once she gets close. Garen has a silence and his ult, darius has a ton of tools, etc. Every other juggernaut has something else they can do beyond just being a giant tank once they get to the backline. Shyv can...dps? Not a bad quality, but its a lot less useful and instant that most other juggernaut's tools.
But she's a freaking Dragon...let her have longer range with less burst damage, at least. Not nerf damage and range.

And you just pointed out why Shyvana shouldn't be classified as a Juggernaut. Just take a look at the other champs who play like Shyvana, Hecarim is one, Rek'sai, Amumu, Renekton, Sejuani and Dr Mundo. Out of these champs only Mundo is considered a Juggernaut, he also probably plays overall the least like Shyvana out of all of them.

The correct classification for Shyvana would be diver, her playstyle is to jump onto a key target and try to DPS them down. What class does that sound like?

The range nerfs are just a dumb consequence of Riot considering Shyvana as a Juggernaut rather than a Diver, dispite the fact she has everything in common with Divers and far less with Juggernauts. Regardless Riot's pushing her in an odd direction because of it. They even state this as a reason for giving her HP on ult, even though their reasoning makes nearly no sense. 

If I'm rushing a Titanic I'd prefer resists to a burst of bonus HP, HP gives me more damage, sure but I lose out the synergy between my Armour and MR on my kit and the HP on Titanic. I think these changes disincentiveise early aggression out of Shyvana, with your increased E damage in Dragon, more reliable engage and lower overall synergy with flat HP I think that the build of choice will be Cinder>GA. Cinder+Rank 1 ult HP give 575 HP before any runes or masteries, run that alongside CotC and you have a near indestructible kill threat, since Shy's bases are high enough to be threatening in the midgame.
What about Drakeless maps? (HA, TT, CS)

With the previous passive iteration on the PBE, Riot mentioned they were exploring alternate options for non-SR maps. Hopefully they follow through on that and don't just leave Shyv without a passive like Azir and Ivern before her.
Um, Azir can raise turrets in ARAM and TT.
There aren't any turrets on the Crystal Scar, and Dominion was still a permanent mode when Riot shifted the AS component from his passive to his W.

It's unfortunate when a champion possesses a passive which only functions within Summoner's Rift. Playing a game of ARAM really shouldn't give a massively-flawed image of a champion's capabilities; herein lies Ivern and Shyvana.

I fail to see where the "better" is.

Basically we ~~traded~~ are forced to trade 800~ effective hp for a 10% bonus damage to dragons (3 cloud dragons spawn inc.) and more hp which are absolutely not needed (1% of 350 is 3.5, and the fact alone that riot tried to sell it as a "buff" for the "juggernaut" items is proof of how much stupid they think we are, and sadly there is a whole Q ladder to back that up) and nobody asked for.
I can already see when i'll have room to go and take a turret or two but HOLD THE FUCK UP GUYS I SAW A DRAGON, sorry guys, i'll go take that dragon so i can restore the stats i originally had so i don't get oneshotted if i actually try to fight 1v1 or in teamfights meanwhile you roll joints around, get caught and apply 0 map pressure and you're not putting me on your backs because riot decided to poof some of my stats.

350 hp might seem a lot ~~no they don't even look as "a lot"~~ because if they're not backed up by resistances they vanish in a couple of autos, and having a cheesy heal i can occasionally use is completely worthless against opponents that know what they're doing, we are speaking about shyvana, not renekton.

So you're screwing up more damage oriented builds for more tanky builds (which are eventually nerfed by these changes) for reason hard to understand beyond "we noticed kids were popped so we decided for our better interest to make these changes"
We are talking of a difference of 800 hp vs 350 hp, sure it might work better with CoC but this ruins greatly the 1v1 potential, and shyvana being a splitpusher mostly NEEDS it.
Also the mastery you already said clearly it's too strong and it's going to be nerfed, what's that? are you going to buff shyvana further after the mastery nerfs? (read, if we feel funny enough we are going to deliver another stealth nerf, because she hadn't had enough so far since devourer made enemy bronze junglers ragequit and throw their keyboards on the ground).
Not counting that going the defensive tree (which was a choice before, now it's mandatory, but hey, we talk a lot of "choice and stuff" just to throw some noise in the ears of the listener), shyvana is going to miss a lot of the damage she got from the thunderlords tree, and considering the HP from ult are situational, is nothing even close to what SOTA gave.

With the trail removal you can't pop most of the "out of combat" effcts, or create those paths that made it dangerous for someone at risk such as a low hp target or a support to walk across, the E is maybe funnier to shoot if you can detonate it mid air or launch it olaf style, but it has an extremely less AOE, so it means i won't be able to mark more targets at once and switch between them during a fight if i get kited unless the circle is at least big as much as the old E aoe, while the W size increase is unnoticeable unless it's massively increased, but in that case it would feel both weird and overpowered, not something i need.
Also the human form is straight up nerfed for no fucking reason, now i can hit multiple targets only if i'm ulting, so it means i can't hold it for gap closing or escaping and everybody can just stand in front of my target and laugh at me as my E goes wasted, and this is a pretty big fucking nerf.

I explicitly asked you to leave shyvana alone once and for all, you say you're gonna look on her, i expect buffs, i receive nerfs. Masked as buffs.
And then there are some sycophants that even praised those changes or people asking me and wondering why i'm so pissed at riot all the times.
Good job riot, keep up the good work.

> I tested these changes by theorycrafting them as soon as i got the news,

Scientists around the world are facepalming. This is not how you conduct a test. That's how you create a hypothesis. A test requires that you actually go out and use these changes. Until you do that, you're just talking out your ass and you need to stop because that's how false information gets spread around and accepted as fact.

Theory crafting rarely works tbh. 

It's all theory. All I ask is that you make your final judgement when the changes ship, because you can't account for everything. Nobody can, especially with the rest of the changes coming in the patch.

So, finally the Dragonborn can absorb dragon souls! 

I think it should give 10 armor and mr per dragon though, 5 armor and mr is not a very good incentive to leave top lane. It really barely makes a difference.

Her current passive gives 5 until level 6, at which point it rises to 10. Level 6 also tends to be roughly in the ball park of when first dragon gets taken. If they raised it to 10, it would be a straight up buff over how it is currently when they're trying to make her passive weaker.

Her current passive gives 20 Armour and MR at level 6, not 10. You're almost always going to be in Dragon form for big fights doubling the resists you receive. If you take 5 seconds to look at her reworked passive you'd notice that it doesn't double into Dragon form. That's a -10 Armour/MR buff at the time when offensive builds really need that 20 Armour/MR. You also can't always get that first Drake, sometimes they're just going to have an arsewhole Nunu who takes Drake after your bot feeds double FB.

I like the E and Uninterruptible Ult, but ultimately I feel she will be weaker now and not worth picking up with the passive change and ult range reduction.
I guess we will see anyway.

As a player who has fond memories of digging out of low elo with this fantastic Draconian Lady of might, some of these these "changes" come as bit of a mishap for myself. Shyvana's greatest assets is minion/ wave clear and DPS, somewhat making up for her lack to negate CC or prevent being kited.
  In my opinion, she depends on sustainability and getting ahead in terms of gold in order to gain an advantage in a game. For Riot to remove those resistances that counteracted her weaknesses for something more trivial like the dragon killing buffs, it makes sense in a lore sort of way but it does not make up for the strengths that the champion Shyvana stood for. 
   However, I suppose we will have to wait until the changes go live to see what happens. I really hope that Riot will up the percentage value and AD/AP ratios on some of her abilities in order to solidify her strengths as a DPS/tank hybrid.

   But in the end, Dragons are still cool and I hope that Shyvana can come out on top of these changes.
